brief_details.emergency_measures: Her iki işçi de hastaneye kaldırıldı.

part3_rca.incident_summary: What happened: İskele çökmesi meydana geldi.. Who: [{'name': 'Mehmet Yılmaz', 'age': 32, 'injury': 'bacağından kırık'}, {'name': 'Ali Demir', 'age': 28, 'injury': 'kafasından yaralandı'}]. Where: Ankara Çankaya'daki 8 katlı konut inşaatı. Event type: Accident. Severity: Serious

five_why_chains.description: Structural failure of the construction site

whys.question: Why did the incident occur?
whys.answer: The structure collapsed.

whys.question: Why did the structure collapse?
whys.answer: The materials used were substandard.

whys.question: Why were substandard materials used?
whys.answer: There was a lack of quality control in procurement.

whys.question: Why was there a lack of quality control?
whys.answer: The procurement process was not properly monitored.

whys.question: Why was the procurement process not monitored?
whys.answer: There were insufficient resources allocated for oversight.

five_why_chains.root_cause: Inadequate resource allocation for quality control in procurement.

five_why_chains.description: Inadequate safety measures at the construction site

whys.question: Why did the incident occur?
whys.answer: Workers were exposed to unsafe conditions.

whys.question: Why were workers exposed to unsafe conditions?
whys.answer: There were no safety protocols in place.

whys.question: Why were there no safety protocols?
whys.answer: Safety training was not provided to the workers.

whys.question: Why was safety training not provided?
whys.answer: The company did not prioritize safety training.

whys.question: Why did the company not prioritize safety training?
whys.answer: Management did not recognize the importance of worker safety.

five_why_chains.root_cause: Management's lack of recognition of the importance of worker safety.

whys.question: Why did the incident occur?
whys.answer: There was a lack of communication between teams.

whys.question: Why was there a lack of communication?
whys.answer: There were no established communication protocols.

whys.question: Why were there no established communication protocols?
whys.answer: The project management was ineffective.

whys.question: Why was project management ineffective?
whys.answer: There was high turnover in management positions.

whys.question: Why was there high turnover in management positions?
whys.answer: The work environment was not supportive.

five_why_chains.root_cause: Unsupportive work environment leading to high turnover in management.

immediate_causes.description: The structure collapsed, leading to the incident.
Workers were exposed to unsafe conditions at the construction site.

underlying_causes.description: The materials used in construction were substandard.
There were no safety protocols in place to protect workers.
The project management was ineffective, leading to poor communication.

root_causes.description: Insufficient resources were allocated for quality control in procurement.
Management did not recognize the importance of worker safety.
The work environment was not supportive, leading to high turnover in management.

brief_details.what: Asit tankından sızıntı oldu, iki çalışan kimyasal yanıklarla acil servise kaldırıldı.

part3_rca.incident_summary: What happened: Asit tankından sızıntı oldu, iki çalışan kimyasal yanıklarla acil servise kaldırıldı.. Who: [{'name': 'Ayşe Kaya', 'age': 35}, {'name': 'Fatma Öztürk', 'age': 29}]. Where: İzmir Aliağa'daki kimya fabrikası. Event type: Accident. Severity: 2. "Serious"

five_why_chains.description: Chemical leak due to equipment failure

whys.question: Why did the incident occur?
whys.answer: There was a chemical leak.

whys.question: Why was there a chemical leak?
whys.answer: The tank was not properly maintained.

whys.question: Why was the tank not properly maintained?
whys.answer: Maintenance schedules were not followed.

whys.question: Why were maintenance schedules not followed?
whys.answer: There was a lack of accountability for maintenance tasks.

whys.question: Why was there a lack of accountability?
whys.answer: The maintenance management system was inadequate.

five_why_chains.root_cause: The maintenance management system was inadequate.

whys.question: Why did the incident occur?
whys.answer: Two employees suffered chemical burns.

whys.question: Why did they suffer chemical burns?
whys.answer: They were exposed to the chemical leak.

whys.question: Why were they exposed to the chemical leak?
whys.answer: They did not know the proper safety protocols.

whys.question: Why did they not know the proper safety protocols?
whys.answer: Safety training was insufficient.

whys.question: Why was safety training insufficient?
whys.answer: There was no regular training program in place.

five_why_chains.root_cause: There was no regular training program in place.

whys.question: Why did the incident occur?
whys.answer: Emergency services were needed for the injured employees.

whys.question: Why were emergency services needed?
whys.answer: The employees were seriously injured.

whys.question: Why were they seriously injured?
whys.answer: There were no immediate emergency response procedures.

whys.question: Why were there no immediate emergency response procedures?
whys.answer: Emergency response plans were not developed or communicated.

whys.question: Why were emergency response plans not developed?
whys.answer: The organization did not prioritize safety planning.

five_why_chains.root_cause: The organization did not prioritize safety planning.

immediate_causes.description: There was a chemical leak from the tank.
Employees were exposed to the chemical leak, leading to burns.

underlying_causes.description: The tank was not properly maintained, leading to the leak.
Employees did not know the proper safety protocols due to lack of training.
There were no immediate emergency response procedures in place for the incident.

root_causes.description: The maintenance management system was inadequate, leading to poor maintenance practices.
There was no regular training program in place for safety protocols.
The organization did not prioritize safety planning, resulting in unpreparedness for emergencies.
